Most Illustrious Sir Bagé, February 21, 1842.

Wishing to contest what Your Excellency Almeida directed, and which was entrusted to me by him, I addressed the enclosed to the Inspector, which you will see along with his response and that of the Accountant, what certainly motivated the inability to issue an order marking the amount that, on account of what the State owes him, should be deducted; which was caused by Your Excellency Your Excellency Collectorate, giving the letter of the amount of the rights to the Collector in the established form, and immediately sending his documents to this one to his attorney, to whom he will say the value of the dispatch made and in which Collectorate, so that he, joining the said documents, may request that the amount of said letter be found for him, which will take place, and the Treasury will issue the order to the collector.

Now, for this there is a long time, because the term of the aforesaid letter can never be less than 30 days, and thus the set-off that Your Excellency intends is effected.

Your servant, Antônio Vicente da Fontoura.

Post scriptum The demand of Alexandre Silveira is so just that if I could, I would advance his disbursement from my own account; however, to effect it it is also necessary that Your Excellency

1842 Senhor Antônio Francisco dos Santos Abreu

Annexed to document CV-6.
